intro: Quiina crenata, commonly known as the crested quina, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, wavy-edged leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded undergrowth. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
